title:
Mathematics for energy systems: Methods, modeling strategies, and
  simulation
authors: Nicklas J\"averg{\aa}rd, Grigor Nika, Adrian Muntean
abstract:
We offer an insight into our mathematical endeavors, which aim to advance the
foundational understanding of energy systems in a broad context, encompassing
facets such as charge transport, energy storage, markets, and collective
behavior. Our working techniques include a combination of well-posed
mathematical models (both deterministic and stochastic), mathematical analysis
arguments (mostly concerned with model dimension reduction and averaging,
periodic homogenization), and simulation tools (numerical approximation
techniques, computational statistics, high-performance computing).
